page.title: 10Ecology
page.content: Dollis Brook is in the south eastern corner of our block. On both sides of the brook are open spaces of cultivated grass land. The northern section slopes down to the brook and is bounded in the north by housing. To the south of the brook the open space stretches well into the existing block. The stream at its deepest point which we studied was as much as 50cm and 3.5 metres wide. The speed of the water was one metre per 11 seconds. Man's presence was noticed in the area in the form of rubbish strewn in the brook. Some items found were a mattress and a punctured football. This rubbish was fortunately not too conspicuous. The brookside area is used by local people for leisure activities such as walking, picnicing, playing in, practicing golf.
